item.title: Fortnite: How to Get a Custom Crosshair
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Get a Custom Crosshair in Fortnite
  • How To Setup a Custom Crosshair With Crosshair V2

The competition in Fortnite Battle Royale is fierce, whether in Builds, Zero Build, or even Reload. Everyone is playing to win, and with players employing new strategies to gain an edge over the competition, it's no wonder others may look to improve their own skills to stay ahead. One vital component of Fortnite is improving accuracy, and various tools can help players achieve this.

Jumping into aim trainers and priming accuracy for success are just some of the ways players can improve. However, something as simple as setting up a custom crosshair can make a huge difference. Custom crosshairs are an excellent way to eliminate the distracting visual clutter of Fortnite's default reticle, allowing players to focus better and take their aim to the next level.

How To Get a Custom Crosshair in Fortnite

Unfortunately, Fortnite itself does not offer custom crosshairs that players can adjust in the settings. However, PC players can turn to third-party software to achieve this feature, leaving console players to rely on a monitor that comes with preset crosshairs as part of its settings.

There are several programs available that provide custom crosshairs, with two standout options being featured on the Epic Games Store: Crosshair V2 and Crosshair X. While Crosshair X is priced at $7.99 , Crosshair V2 is free , making it a great choice for those looking for a cost-effective solution.

How To Setup a Custom Crosshair With Crosshair V2

Crosshair V2 is an easy start-up and play solution for players looking to get their hands on a solid custom crosshair for Fortnite . Before players can begin setting up their crosshair, they must first disable the reticle provided in Fortnite . This can be done by:

  1. Navigating over to Settings and heading to the Game UI Tab.
  2. Setting Reticle to Off.

Once done, players can go ahead and open up Crosshair V2 via the Epic Games Store. Opening up the software will automatically apply a crosshair to the center of the screen, one which can then be altered in-game with the following hotkeys:

  • Z: Change Color
  • C: Change Size
  • X: Change Shape

Crosshair V2 will need to remain open for the crosshair to remain active , but players can hit F2 to hide the application's menu , letting players get back into the action without any distractions. The simplicity Crosshair V2 provides makes it an excellent option for players looking for a quick and easy solution.

If players want to get even more customization options for their custom crosshair, they can always get their hands on Crosshair X, either through the Epic Games Store or by upgrading to it through Crosshair V2 by pressing D9.

If the crosshair does not show up in game, ensure that Display Mode is set to Fullscreen or Windowed and that Rendering is set to Direct X12.

item.title: Genshin Impact Leak Reveals Major Mavuika Changes
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • According to a new leak, Mavuika in Genshin Impact will receive major nerfs in Version 5.3, potentially pushing her towards a hypercarry role.
  • The changes to Mavuika signal a potential departure from the established pattern in Genshin Impact.

Genshin Impact has made some major changes to Mavuika in the latest beta build, and players may not necessarily like what these changes imply. Traditionally, Archons in Genshin Impact have leaned towards support roles, usually in a way that best exemplifies their element. While Raiden Shogun can be played as a hypercarry, her ability kit primarily offers Energy Recharge and off-field Electro Damage. On the other hand, Zhongli is considered to be the best Shield Support in Genshin Impact – which certainly fits Geo as an element.

In contrast to the seven Archons, the Fatui Harbingers in Genshin Impact are considered selfish hypercarries, with very little off-field or support potential in their ability kit. Both Arlecchino and Tartaglia are perfect examples of what a Harbinger brings to the table, even if the latter is humorously used as support by certain Neuvillette teams in Genshin Impact . However, if the recent changes to Mavuika come to pass, Version 5.3 is set to break this assumed pattern in a major way.

According to HomDGCat, the latest beta build for Version 5.3 comes with a significant nerf to Mavuika's damage. While many players were worried about Mavuika being too powerful as a hypercarry, the new nerf comes with an unfortunate side effect to her support abilities. By reducing the damage bonus provided by Mavuika via her Elemental Burst, it funnels the Pyro Archon further into a hypercarry role. It should be noted that Mavuika in Genshin Impact is still capable of dealing off-field Pyro Damage, but there is another aspect of the changes that could be seen as eye-catching.

Genshin Impact: Mavuika Changes (V3)

Elemental Skill

  • The Named Moment
    • Flamestrider Charged Attack Cyclic DMG: 195.5% (down from 271.6%)
    • Flamestrider Charged Attack Final DMG: 272.0% (down from 299.2%)

Ascension Passive

  • Gift of Flaming Flowers
    • When a nearby party member triggers a Nightsoul Burst, Mavuika's ATK increases by 30% (down from 35%) for 10s.

  • Kiongozi
    • After using her Elemental Burst, Hour of Burning Skies, every point of Fighting Spirit present when it is used increases the DMG that the current active party member deals by 0.2% (down from 0.25%). The maximum increase obtainable this way is 40% (down from 50%), and this effect lasts 20s, decaying over this duration until it reaches 0.

Constellation

  • The Ashen Price
    • When in the Nightsoul's Blessing State, Mavuika's Base ATK is increased by 200, and she obtains the following effects based on All-Fire Armaments' form:
      • Rings of Searing Radiance: Nearby opponents' DEF decreased by 20%.
      • Flamestrider: Mavuika's Normal Attacks, Charged Attacks, and her Sunfell Slice from the Elemental Burst, Hour of Burning Skies, deal 60% (down from 80%), 90% (down from 130%), and 120% (down from 180%) of her ATK as increased DMG respectively.

  • The Leader's Resolve
    • Enhances the effects of the Passive Talent "Kiongozi":
      • The DMG increase gained after using the Elemental Burst, Hour of Burning Skies, will not decay over time, and gains an additional 10% DMG increase (up from 0%).

While the changes apply a notable nerf to Mavuika's second Ascension Passive, the shortcomings are restored in her fourth Constellation. This means that Genshin Impact players are expected to pull several copies of the Pyro Archon to enjoy Mavuika's original bonuses as a Support. Though the power level of Mavuika is now comparable to Arlecchino in Genshin Impact , her Constellations can arguably be seen as a worrisome trend that began in Fontaine.

Whereas Fontaine-era characters such as Wriothesley or Chiori become complete at C1, Mavuika (and Citlali) are almost encouraged to be at C4, a goal that the vast majority of players would struggle to meet. That being said, Version 5.3 is expected to go through two more builds before its release version, which should give the Genshin Impact community plenty of time to provide feedback. Both Mavuika and Citlali in Genshin Impact are expected to feature on the Event Banners for the full duration of the patch, which is set to launch on January 1, 2025.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail - Sunday Build Guide
item.description:
Sunday

Imaginary

Harmony

5-Star

Guides

Build Guide

Level-Up Materials

Team Composition

Best Light Cone

Back to All Characters

Sunday has been one of the most anticipated Penacony characters in Honkai: Star Rail , largely due to his unique personality, compelling involvement in the storyline, and the fact that he was introduced as a playable character later than the rest of the cast. The anticipation has paid off, as Sunday proves to be an exceptional support unit. His abilities not only enhance hypercarry characters but also significantly boost summons, a feature expected to gain prominence in the evolving combat meta. This is especially relevant as players explore the new Remembrance path, set to redefine team strategies starting from version 3.0.

While Sunday's full potential will likely be realized as future characters and mechanics are introduced, he can already a game-changer with the current roster. Luckily, players can already optimize his performance by equipping him with existing light cones, relics, and planar ornaments. Here's how to best build Sunday in Honkai: Star Rail.

Best Sunday Build In Honkai: Star Rail

Light Cone

Relic Set

Relic Stat

  1. A Grounded Ascent
  2. But the Battle Isn't Over
  3. Earthly Escapade
  4. Past and Future
  5. Planetary Rendezvous
  6. Carve the Moon, Weave the Clouds
  7. Dreamville Adventure
  8. Dance! Dance! Dance!

  1. 4pc Sacerdos' Relived Ordeal
  2. 2pc Sacerdos' Relived Ordeal + 2pc Messenger Traversing Hackerspace

Planar Ornaments

  1. Broken Keel
  2. Lushaka, the Sunken Seas

  • Body: Crit DMG
  • Feet: SPD
  • Planar Sphere: HP / DEF
  • Link Rope: Energy Regeneration Rate
  • Sub-stat: SPD, Crit DMG, Effect RES, HP%, DEF%

Best Sunday Relics In Honkai: Star Rail

Sunday’s playstyle in Honkai: Star Rail is quite similar to Bronya and Sparkle, as he focuses on buffing the team based on his Crit DMG while also advancing allies forward—particularly effective for summons. His optimal build follows a familiar pattern, especially regarding relics and stat priorities, but with a few unique twists that enhance his supportive role.

The ideal relic set for Sunday is the 4-piece Sacerdos' Relived Ordeal . The 2-piece bonus boosts his Speed, which is essential for timing his buffs. The 4-piece bonus perfectly complements his kit, as both his Skill and Ultimate are single-target abilities that provide a near-permanent Crit DMG buff to the chosen ally. This synergy makes it invaluable for hypercarry and summon-based teams.

For players who struggle to obtain optimal pieces, a 2-piece Sacerdos' Relived Ordeal mixed with 2-piece Messenger Traversing Hackerspace is also viable. This setup further enhances Sunday’s Speed, making it easier to adjust his turn order relative to the DPS. Ideally, Sunday should act slightly slower - 1 or 2 less speed than the main DPS to advance their turn and boost their damage potential right after their action.

For planar ornaments, Broken Keel is the top choice being one of the best general support planar sets, providing a Crit DMG boost to the entire team as long as Sunday’s Effect RES reaches 30%. Alternatively, Lushaka, the Sunken Seas offers great utility, granting energy regeneration for Sunday and boosting ATK for the first ally in the team setup. This option shines in teams where the hypercarry or summon unit scales well with ATK.

For the main and sub-stats of the relics and planar ornaments, players have considerable flexibility, as the only crucial stat is Crit DMG. It is recommended that players aim for at least 200% Crit DMG for Sunday, which means prioritizing this stat on the Body piece as well as through sub-stats. Beyond Crit DMG, players should focus on maintaining relatively high SPD by equipping SPD boots and accumulating enough SPD sub-stats to keep Sunday slightly slower than the target character, allowing for optimal turn order synergy. To activate his Ultimate as frequently as possible, equipping Energy Regeneration Rate on the Link Rope is essential.

For the remaining stats, players have more freedom and can prioritize defensive options such as Effect RES (Sunday's traces also provide Effect RES, which help him reach 30% easily), along with HP and DEF, to enhance Sunday’s overall survivability.

Best Sunday Light Cones In Honkai: Star Rail

Sunday undoubtedly benefits the most from his signature light cone, A Grounded Ascent as his best light cone option. It not only boosts his Energy but also significantly enhances the targeted ally's DMG output, even without any superimposition. Additionally, although Sunday is already SP neutral, this light cone can make him SP positive, as it allows him to recover a skill point once every two uses of his Skill or Ultimate.

For players seeking less premium alternatives, Bronya's signature, But the Battle Isn't Over, serves as a viable 5-star option from the standard banner. Similar to A Grounded Ascent, it provides DMG boosts to the target, energy regeneration for Sunday, and the ability to recover skill points every two Ultimates. Another solid 5-star option is Sparkle's light cone, Earthly Escapade , which enhances Sunday’s Crit DMG and grants the team Crit Rate and Crit DMG. However, unlike Sparkle, Sunday struggles to generate skill points consistently, limiting the uptime of this light cone’s effect and making it less appealing compared to freemium options like Bronya’s signature.

For 4-star options, Past and Future is the best fit, as it synergizes well with Sunday’s ability to advance allies forward while boosting their DMG. For teams with multiple Imaginary characters, Planetary Rendezvous can also be a strong choice, offering a DMG boost to allies of the same element. Additionally, Carve the Moon, Weave the Clouds, Dance! Dance! Dance!, and Dreamville Adventure are more generalized and versatile support options that can suit Sunday depending on team needs. Ultimately, while his BIS light cone is ideal, it is not essential as it is for characters like Acheron or Boothill, who rely heavily on their signature light cones, especially considering that Sunday is a support unit that doesn't need too much min-maxing.

Sunday Trace Priority In Honkai: Star Rail

While players should aim to maximize all of Sunday’s traces and additional skill tree buffs or effects (excluding his Basic ATK), those low on resources should prioritize the following order for the most significant impact:

1. Skill

2. Ultimate = Talent

3. Basic ATK

item.title: Roblox: Kingdom of Essentia Codes (December 2024)
item.description:
Kingdom of Essentia is a fun Roblox experience where you can explore your own magical kingdom and build various structures. The game allows you to earn Coins which you can use to purchase different things. Also, it has promo codes that you can activate to get some free bonuses. In this Roblox guide, we will tell you about Kingdom of Essentia codes and how to redeem them.

All Kingdom of Essentia Codes

Working Kindom of Essentia Codes

Currently, Kingdom of Essentia doesn’t have codes that you can redeem. We will update this section as soon as the developers add new freebies.

Expired Kindom of Essentia Codes

Currently, Kingdom of Essentia doesn’t have expired bonuses. If any of these promo codes become unavailable to you and other users, we will update this paragraph and add them to the list.

Promo codes in Kingdom of Essentia will help you speed up your progress and gain access to new features. This Roblox experience has various mini-games that you can play to earn Coins, and building new structures will unlock more of them. So, you should redeem all the available promo codes as they will help you access these mini-games faster.

Also, you should be aware that promo codes may expire in the future. So, we don’t recommend that you wait too long before redeeming them, as they may become unavailable.

How to Redeem Kingdom of Essentia Codes

In order to get your free rewards in Kingdom of Essentia , you will need to redeem promo codes. The redemption process is simple, and if you've played other Roblox games, you will quickly figure out how it works. Here is a list of steps you need to follow to redeem Kingdom of Essentia codes and claim your bonuses:

  • Launch Kingdom of Essentia and wait for this Roblox game to load.
  • After that, look at the left side of the screen. There you will see a few buttons, including one that says “Codes”. Click on it and the Promo Codes menu will pop up.
  • Enter the code you want to redeem in the Promo Codes menu.
  • Click on the Redeem button.
  • The reward is yours.

How to Get New Kingdom of Essentia Codes

The developers of Kingdom of Essentia can release new Roblox promo codes and you definitely shouldn’t miss these bonuses. You can simply bookmark this article and check it from time to time for new rewards. Also, you can follow the official media related to this Roblox experience.

  • Roblox Group

item.title: Halls Of Torment: Class Tier List
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Swordsman offers the most balanced gameplay, ideal for a smooth playthrough. The Swordsman has the best base health rating and diverse upgrade potential.
  • Shieldmaiden prioritizes defense to become one of the best playable options. The Shieldmaiden is best played by focusing on increasing Block Strength for both offensive and defensive potential.
  • Players should understand their chosen character's strengths and weaknesses and address them through strategic level up decisions. The Shieldmaiden's top priority should be to increase Block Strength for offense and defense.
  • The Archer is an efficient long-range specialist with strong critical striking abilities. Players should prioritize increasing health and regeneration to combat its vulnerability in close-range encounters.

The armies of Hell are calling to players in Halls Of Torment , as gamers are tasked with surviving for 30 minutes against legions of the undead and undesirable in a number of horrifying locations. The game features a simple premise and very user-friendly mechanics to make it an easy title to get engrossed in for hours on end.

Halls Of Torment features 7 different playable characters, each with their own unique weapons and skills, for players to choose from in an attempt to survive the hordes of Hell. From long-range specialists to cunning sorcerers, this is how the character classes in the game compare to one another.

Updated on December 3, 2024 by Rhenn Taguiam: With Halls of Torment having just celebrated its million sale milestone in October, fans of the love letter to computer RPGs might want to dive back into Hell's fiery depths to fight Tormented Lords and save the world from certain doom. However, while Halls of Torment offers countless hours of fun, fans of the game know that their Class choice factors in heavily on the kind of gameplay style they will exhibit for their playthrough. However, just how should players pick their Classes in Halls of Torment? While all Classes have their merits, some are just built to be easier to use compared to others.

S Rank - Bane of The Tormented Lords

Built Especially For Smoother Playthroughs

Players who want to enjoy Halls of Torment to its fullest might want to pick Classes they can thoroughly use and may even take them to the endgame. While these Classes are traditionally built for hack-and-slash gameplay, this proven playstyle not only enables players to satisfyingly hack their way past hordes of zombies, but they are also recognizable for their ease of use and accessibility. Fans who want to make the most out of a Halls of Torment run should use these Classes before trying to dive into more complex classes.

Swordsman

First Playable Class for a Reason

Defensive

Miscellaneous

Offensive

Max Health

500

Movement Speed

5.0m/s

Damage

100

Health Regeneration

1.0/s

Pickup Range

4.0m

Attack Speed

0.9/s

Defense

20

XP Gain

100%

Multistrike

1

Block Strength

10

Crit Chance

20%

Crit Bonus

65%

Force

30kbk

Range

7.0m

Area

45 Degrees

The first playable character in Halls Of Torment happens to be one of the best options to overcome the hordes of undead and monsters, as the Swordsman provides the most balanced gameplay experience and an excellent base from which to build a formidable warrior.

General Traits

The Swordsman has above-average ratings across the board, providing decent damage, speed, and the highest base health rating in the game to get players off to a good start. With careful consideration of upgrades for this character, the Swordsman can be crafted into a near-unbeatable threat to the armies of the Tormented Lords.

Ideal Strategy

The Swordsman is best played with a well-rounded approach that does not necessarily focus on improving one or two facets of its combat abilities, but a broad perspective that sees each area of its skill set get some attention. It has one of the strongest base stats, so the best strategy to apply to this character class is to make upgrades in a variety of areas , including strength, attack speed, movement speed, and range. The Swordsman will also benefit from using short-range abilities like Dragon's Breath and Radiant Aura.

Shieldmaiden

The Best Defense Is A Good Offense

Defensive

Miscellaneous

Offensive

Max Health

400

Movement Speed

4.5m/s

Damage

200

Health Regeneration

0.2/s

Pickup Range

3.0m

Attack Speed

0.55/s

Defense

0

XP Gain

100%

Multistrike

1

Block Strength

20

Crit Chance

0%

Crit Bonus

150%

Force

60kbk

Range

3.0m

Area

2.0m

There is no one specific key to success in Halls Of Torment , however, the best strategy a player can employ is understanding their character's strengths and weaknesses and addressing them as they level up. For the Shieldmaiden , defense is the foundation upon which this character class builds itself into one of the best playable options in the game.

General Traits

This character uses a melee primary weapon to deal damage, but unlike its counterpart the Swordsman, it uses its shield to bash into its foes with a more potent strike. In technical terms, her War Hammer can apply a 0.2-sec momentary Stun to delay opponents, while her Shield Bash can Knockback Elites in exchange for not having crits and being unaffected by Multistrike.

Ideal Strategy

Players using the Shieldmaiden will benefit from increasing their Block Strength , as this influences the character's offensive potential as much as it does its defensive capabilities. With the best defensive rating in the game and an impressive base stat in critical damage, players will be set up for success from the very start by using this character. Much like the Swordsman, the Shieldmaiden would also benefit from short-range abilities such as Dragon's Breath, as their heavy armor does pose a limitation to the speed of their movements.

A Rank - Slayers Of The Undead

Specialized Ways Of Dealing With Foes

Compared to heavy-hitters like the Swordsman and the Shield Maiden, these particular Classes enjoy having more technical components to fiddle with in order to diversify their approaches in combat. Players who want a bit more challenge controlling the battlefield to dish out damage will enjoy these slayers of the Undead, as their specializations can add quite a lot of thrill to playthroughs.

Archer

Long-Ranged Specialist

Defensive

Miscellaneous

Offensive

Max Health

400

Movement Speed

5.5m/s

Damage

60

Health Regeneration

1.0/s

Pickup Range

3.0m

Attack Speed

0.95/s

Defense

10

XP Gain

100%

Multistrike

3

Block Strength

0

Crit Chance

33%

Crit Bonus

200%

Force

3.0

Range

75m/s

Area

1.0m

A long-range specialist may be a little out of place in Halls Of Torment , given that most of the combat in the game takes place up close, but the Archer still manages to establish itself as a fairly reliable character class.

General Traits

Despite being at its best from a distance, the Archer's two-arrow attack is particularly potent with its long base range and a high chance of critical strikes. Additionally, the Archer has the fastest base movement speed among all characters, which helps to establish and maintain distance, as well as weave through the crowds of monsters as the field begins to get congested.

Ideal Strategy

Despite its speed and attacking abilities, the Archer has the lowest health rating in the game, making it the most vulnerable when being surrounded by enemies. Players who use this character should prioritize increasing its health and regeneration speed to give them the best chance of survival. Given its prowess from long range, abilities such as the Phantom Needles are a great addition to the Archer's arsenal as it behaves just like their primary weapon and can deal with foes from different angles. Given its low health count, players should also consider equipping the Archer with the Firewalker Boots or Bogged Boots to provide an additional challenge for adversaries looking to hunt the player down.

Sorceress

Spark Is The Cleanser

Defensive

Miscellaneous

Offensive

Max Health

300

Movement Speed

5.5m/s

Damage

100

Health Regeneration

0.0/s

Pickup Range

3.0m

Attack Speed

0.75/s

Defense

0

XP Gain

100%

Multistrike

5

Block Strength

20

Crit Chance

20%

Crit Bonus

100%

Force

3

Range

-

Area

-

Wielding perhaps the best primary weapon in Halls Of Torment , the Sorceress class character can effectively dispatch foes using her bolts of lightning, which chains across multiple targets within proximity to one another.

General Traits

This character is generally the last that players will unlock, as it requires 10,000 kills to be made in a single run in the Forgotten Viaducts, however, it is worth the effort. Like the Archer, the Sorceress lacks a noteworthy health rating but makes up for it with its offensive abilities and agility. Being able to wield Chain Lightning by default, the Sorceress enjoys a constant base 50% chance of proccing an effect on crit, making her the ideal unit to create should players want to pursue supreme crowd control.

Ideal Strategy

As is with the Archer, players should prioritize improving the Sorceress' health and regeneration ratings to keep her in the fight as the run increases in difficulty. They are particularly effective against elite enemies, however, given her attack does not have the cone of effect that offensive characters like Swordsman do, it would be wise to equip the Sorceress with abilities that can inflict damage on a high quantity of enemies . Additionally, given her lower health rating, rings like the Necromancer's Clutch would be perfect for a Sorceress build as it provides an extra pair of hands to help ward off the advances of Hell's army.

Cleric

Unleash Divine Fury

Defensive

Miscellaneous

Offensive

Max Health

400

Movement Speed

4.5m/s

Damage

1000

Health Regeneration

1.0/s

Pickup Range

3.0m

Attack Speed

0.666/s

Defense

0

XP Gain

100%

Multistrike

1

Block Strength

0

Crit Chance

20%

Crit Bonus

100%

Force

20kbk

Range

7.0m

Area

3.0m

Toeing the line between A and B rank, the Cleric has some great attacking advantages that are greatly hindered by the limitations in its speed and mobility. Using its staff to produce a two-hit attack with a wide cone of effect, the Cleric packs a serious punch with its base offense abilities. However, he has the slowest recharge time on his attacks, which can be incredibly limiting as the run becomes more difficult.

General Traits

Unlike traditional healing Clerics in other RPGs, the Cleric of Halls of Torment uses his Holy Scepter to inflict divine retribution against his opponents. It's for this reason why his default AOE attacks are always divided equally among opponents, with a base 50% chance of proccing Fragile or Affliction on enemies.

General Strategy

Players wishing to run the gauntlet with the Cleric should put as much of their resources into improving their attack speed as possible , as this will be a genuine problem as the round progresses. Additionally, improving this character's movement speed is invaluable to ensuring success, so using the upgrades to do this or equipping the Elven Slippers will curb some of the limitations the Cleric has. Once movement and attack speed are improved, players will find this character to be particularly effective in clearing out enemies.

B Rank - Soldiers Of Hell

The Road To Hell Is Paved With Difficulties

Players looking for more of a challenge in their Halls of Torment gameplay might want to put themselves at a slight difficulty curve by using these Classes. While not "bad" in their own right, their more technical nature and more demanding mechanics add an additional layer of challenge to the Halls of Torment experience. Players may appreciate studying the other Classes before venturing into the technicalities of these soldiers of Hell.

Exterminator

Fire Is The Cleanser

Defensive

Miscellaneous

Offensive

Max Health

400

Movement Speed

5.0m/s

Damage

50

Health Regeneration

1.0/s

Pickup Range

3.0m

Attack Speed

3.0/s

Defense

10

XP Gain

100%

Multistrike

1.00

Block Strength

0

Crit Chance

5%

Crit Bonus

100%

Force

1.00s

Range

15m/s

Area

100%

At first glance, the Exterminator looks like an incredibly effective offensive character capable of burning all in their sight to ash. Unfortunately, while the steady stream of flame from its primary weapon is a great starting point, it does not prove effective when facing more durable enemies as they get closer to the player.

General Traits

This character is best used at a distance, particularly as it does not have the defensive rating to hold off enemy attacks for too long. Its Flame Caster summons a stream of fire akin to a flamethrower, where every subsequent hit to an enemy reduces the fire's damage to 80% with a 10% Burn Chance. What's interesting about the Flame Caster is that it cannot be blocked, which makes the Exterminator somewhat of a glass cannon to use.

Ideal Strategy

Players using the Exterminator will want to prioritize making improvements to their defense and block ratings to give the fire specialist a fighting chance against the forces of the tormented Lords. Additionally, using upgrades on the range and potency of the Exterminator's flame will make for a more effective character , particularly as has a good chance to inflict flame damage on all foes. While it is a great option for the earlier halls where there are weaker foes, Exterminator struggles to keep up as the game's difficulty increases.

Warlock

In Summons We Trust

Defensive

Miscellaneous

Offensive

Max Health

350

Movement Speed

5.0m/s

Damage

50

Health Regeneration

0.0/s

Pickup Range

4.0m

Attack Speed

0.6/s

Defense

0

XP Gain

100%

Multistrike

2

Block Strength

0

Crit Chance

10%

Crit Bonus

200%

Force

1.5s

Range

-

Area

0.5m

Aside from introducing the Golem ability to the game, the Warlock unfortunately does not pack a lot of punch to warrant investing a lot of time in the character. Its primary weapon involves summoning spirits to do its bidding which, while it has a very long range and homing abilities on enemies, is a very slow and relatively ineffective ability when enemies are closing in from all sides.

General Traits

Unlike other games where necromancer-type characters often have their summons as a separate spell that consumes resources, the Warlock by default uses Ravaging Spectres as his weapon. Upon use, the weapon summons Spectres which disappear after 2.0s have elapsed or after hitting an opponent up to 20 times. While they cannot hit crits by default, boosting base critical chance can start allowing Spectres to do so.

Ideal Strategy

Players using the Warlock will want to increase their attack speed first and foremost, as the character's attack does not deal any base critical damage, so quantity is of the essence if they are to have a chance of surviving. Outside that, equipping the right gear to support its summoning skills and provide additional sources of attack would be best for a Warlock build, so making use of items like the Necromancer's Clutch and the Firewalker Boots are strongly recommended.
